Gracias a la experiencia que tenía en esta actividad, pudo comenzar a generar los ingresos que requería en su hogar para poder sostener a sus 2 hijas. Actualmente Rosmery tiene muy buenas ventas y con el ánimo de poder responder a un gran pedido que le ha hecho un cliente, busca que un préstamo le permita comprar insumos y materias primas como telas, hilos, y agujas para poder confeccionar un gran pedido que le ha hecho un cliente suyo.
De esta manera su negocio podrá seguir saliendo adelante y brindarle una buena calidad de vida en su hogar. Además, Rosmery sueña con que su taller logre crecer y algún día pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en: Rosemery has had to overcome many adversities in her life, however she has always had the strength to overcome difficulties and continue getting ahead with her family.  As the single mother of two daughters and head of the family; the girls’ father abandoned them a long time ago without providing any financial support.  Rosemery has had to work hard for a long time to get the family ahead.  She has about 40 years’ experience making clothing.  She learned this from her mother and worked by her side when she was very young.  Thanks to the experience from this, she was able to begin generating the necessary income that she needed to support her two daughters.  She currently has good sales and with good effort she will be able to fill a large order that a customer has made.  She is asking for this loan in order to buy materials and supplies such as fabric, thread, and needles.  In this way her business will continue getting ahead and she can provide a good quality of life to her household.  Rosmery also dreams of growing her workshop so that she can provide jobs for those who need them the most.

loans.use: to buy materials and supplies so she can fill a large order.

loans.name: Dina Zoraida

texts.es:
Dina se encuentra casada y tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad, y debido a que los ingresos que generaba su esposo no estaban siendo suficientes para poder sostener los gastos de su hogar, decidió comenzar a trabajar para poder contribuir económicamente en su hogar. Fue así como desde hace 5 años comenzó con una venta de productos de uso personal a través de catálogos, y gracias a esto ha logrado tener ingresos con los cuales su familia puede gozar de una mejor calidad de vida. 

En su negocio tiene muchos clientes y esto le permite tener muy buenas ventas, y es por esto que ahora busca que un préstamo le permita comprar productos de uso personal para tener un buen surtido para la temporada de día de madres.

De esta manera sus ingresos aumentarán considerablemente, pues esta es una época en la que le va muy bien, además, su familia con mejores ingresos podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Dina is married and has a six-year-old son. Since the income generated by her husband wasn't enough to cover their home expenses, she decided to start working so that she could contribute financially at home. That is how five years ago she started selling personal products by catalogue, and it has allowed her to earn enough income for her family to enjoy a better quality of life.

Her business has a lot of customers and this allows her to have very good sales, which is why she is now looking for a loan that will allow her to purchase personal products so that she is well stocked for the Mothers' Day season.

This way, her income will increase substantially, because this is a time of the year when business goes very well for her. Also, with better income her family will be able to have a better quality of life and better financial opportunities for progress.

loans.use: To purchase personal products so that she is well stocked for the Mothers' Day season.

loans.name: Suyapa Yolibeth

texts.es:
Suyapa Yolibeth tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, y reside en la Comunidad de Gualaco, en el departamento de Olancho. Desde hace 11 años trabaja vendiendo ropa y otros productos de uso personal. Inició en una parte de su casa y ahora su tienda tiene dos plantas y cuenta con una empleada para que le ayude a atender a los clientes. Suyapa también es maestra de educación primaria y le encanta enseñarles cosas nuevas y educativas a sus alumnos.
El préstamo que solicita Suyapa lo necesita para comprar mercadería nueva como ser vestidos, zapatos, jeans, blusas, ropa interior, sandalias, entre otros productos. 
Una de las metas de Suyapa es enseñarles a sus hijos a trabajar de forma honesta, ya que es la mejor herencia que puede dejarles. La vida económica de Suyapa ha cambiado grandemente desde que recibe el apoyo de los préstamos de FAMA. Ha sido cliente de FAMA desde hace sis ciclos y es una cliente que ha cancelado sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Suyapa Yolibeth is 39 years old, married, and has four children. She resides in the community of Gualaco, which is in the Department of Olancho. Suyapa has been selling clothes and other personal use products for 11 years. She started her business in a section of her house and now she has two levels and an employee who helps with attending to the customers. Suyapa is also an elementary school teacher who enjoys showing new things to her students and helping them learn.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy new merchandise such as dresses, shoes, jeans, blouses, undergarments, sandals, and other products. One of Suyapa's goals is to teach her children how to work in an honest fashion, which is the best legacy that she could leave for them. Her financial standing has changed greatly since receiving support in the form of loans from FAMA. Suyapa has been a client of FAMA for six loan cycles and has repaid her obligations on time.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and sandals.

loans.name: Sonia Maria

texts.es:
Sonia se encuentra casada y tiene 4 hijos, y junto con su esposo decidieron abrir hace un tiempo un negocio de comidas rápidas, en el cual ofrecen a sus clientes una gran variedad de productos. Con este negocio, puede generar los ingresos que se requieren en su hogar, de modo que puede ofrecer a sus 4 hijos una buena calidad de vida. Gracias a que sus ventas han venido aumentando, Sonia ahora busca que un préstamo le permita comprar insumos para la preparación de las comidas rápidas y así poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

De esta manera podrá seguir sacando su negocio adelante y así seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes una buena atención y buena calidad en sus comidas. Además, con los ingresos provenientes del negocio su familia seguirá teniendo oportunidades económicas para sostener sus gastos y progresar económicamente.
texts.en:
Sonia is married and has four children. Some time ago, she and her husband decided to open a fast food business where they offer their customers a great variety of products.
The business allows her to generate the income her household needs, so that she can offer her four children a good quality of life. Thanks to the fact that her sales have been increasing, Sonia is now seeking a loan that will allow her to purchase ingredients to prepare the fast food, so that she can satisfy her customers' demand.
This way, she will be able to keep her business moving forward, so that she can continue offering her customers good service and high-quality meals. Also, the business' income will allow her family to continue to have the financial means to cover their expenses and advance financially.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare fast food, so that she can satisfy her customers' demand.

loans.name: Leng's Group

texts.en: Leng is 51 years old and single. She lives in a village located in Prey Chhor district and has been a farmer to support her living for twenty five years. This is Leng's first loan with VisionFund. She is now leading a group of three members, all of whom are new to VisionFund, to apply for loans. As the leader, she plans to use her portion to spend on labor, which she will hire to harvest her crops, as well as to buy fertilizers. She hopes this loan will enable her to make more income so that she can have enough capital for her business and also build on some saving to support herself in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and spend on labor fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Lucia Heriberta

texts.es:
La señora Lucia tiene 42 años de edad es casada y tiene dos hijos. Desde hace 23 años se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas y maíz. Ella debe caminar dos kilómetros a pie hasta llegar al terreno donde realiza sus cultivos, ella siembra en la laderas del cerro El Tigre, fue su papá quien le enseño este trabajo.  

Doña Lucia aborda un autobús que tarda treinta minutos en llegar a la ciudad, donde compra los insumos que necesita para sus cultivos.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando Lucia a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 6 sacos de fertilizantes y un galón de herbicidas, para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Lo que ella quiere es comprar todos los insumos de una sola vez, para evitar tanto viaje al pueblo a comprar por poquitos, ya que esto le implica más gastos y perdida de tiempo.  Además que aplicara de forma oportuna todos los insumos a su cultivo y obtendrá una mejor cosecha y mejores ingresos.

Ella desea ahorrar y construir una casa de ladrillo para sus hijos, ya que actualmente viven en una casa de latas deterioradas y en malas condiciones.
texts.en:
Lucia is 42 years old, married, and has two children.  She has been raising vegetables and corn for 23 years.  She must walk two kilometers to reach her crops, which she plants alongside the El Tigre Mountain.  It was her father who showed her how to do this kind of work.


Lucia boards the bus that takes 30 minutes to reach the city where she buys the supplies she needs for her crops.


The loan she is requesting through Fundación Campo is so that she can buy six sacks of fertilizer and a gallon of herbicide so she can plant 7,000 square meters of corn.  What she wants to do is buy all of her supplies at once so that she doesn’t have to make so many trips to town to buy a little bit at a time, which increases her cost and requires more time.  It will also allow her to apply all supplies to her crops and obtain a better harvest and better income.


She wants to save up and build a brick home for her children, since they currently live in a deteriorating home in bad condition.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her crops.

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
Chanthy is 57 years old and a married mother of eight children and they live in an area located in the Dambae district of Cambodia.Out of the eight children, she still has four children to take care of. Her family’s source of income is rice farming and cassava plantation. She has been in this business for 10 years. Her main challenge is lack of working capital to support her business. 

Chanthy’s group consists of two members. While she has been with VisionFund for four cycles, the other member has completed two loan cycles. The past loans have helped Chanthly gradually improve her living. With her current source of income, she is able to earn around 19,000 KHR per day to spend on daily expenses. Chanthy, who is the leader, is now requesting another loan and will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase the crop yields and have a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: La Vecindad Del Cinco Group

texts.es: El grupo   la Vecindad del Cinco está conformado por 6 miembros los cuales todos se dedican al comercio minoritario como venta de ropa, bodegas, golosinas etc. Tiene formado hace mas de 9 años los cuales han hecho una labor extraordinaria con las ganancias de las prestaciones. Un caso en particular es el de la señora Martha, con 52 años de edad sale adelante cada día con su negocio de venta ambulatoria de golosinas, el cual le ha dado muchas satisfacciones como los estudios de sus 2 hijos en el colegio, alimentos, vestimenta y un techo donde vivir. Con el presente préstamo piensa invertirlo en comprar  mas golosinas y cambiar el modo de venderlos y comprarse un puesto. Cada integrante del  grupo  la vecindad del cinco tiene un desempeño laboral distinto. Pero todos coinciden en la dedicación  y el esfuerzo que dan todos los días para progresar  y salir a delante.
texts.en:
The group "La Vencindad del Cinco" consists of six members, all of whom engage in small businesses selling clothes, groceries, candy, and other items. The group was formed more than nine years ago and has done extraordinary work with the revenues earned from their loans.

One case in particular is that of Sra. Martha. She is 52 years old and presses forward each day in her business of selling candy as a street vendor. Martha has great satisfaction in knowing that her two children have an education, food, clothing, and a roof over their heads. With this current loan, she plans to invest in the purchase of more candy. She also plans to change her method of selling her products by acquiring a vending stall.

Each member of the group "La Vencindad del Cinco" has a distinct business, but they all share the same level of dedication and effort that is required to make progress and move forward every day.

loans.use: to buy candy and to acquire a vending stall.

loans.name: María Sthella

texts.es:
En una localidad llamada Tierras Amarillas del cantón Rocafuerte cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Mejorando El Futuro, este sector es conocido por su agricultura ya que gran parte de sus habitantes se dedican a los sembríos de ciclo corto.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 34 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 17, 13, 11 y 7 años de edad, dos de ellos estudian en colegio y la menor en escuela. El marido es agricultor.
 
Nuestra amiga para salir adelante y con ayuda del primer crédito que recibió del banco surtió una pequeña tienda de comestibles en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde. Su esposo le ayuda de vez en cuando, tiene un año con su negocio y a pesar de que no tiene mucho tiempo tiene muchos clientes ya que no hay muchas tiendas por el sector, ella también le da parte del crédito para su esposo el cual siembra arroz y maíz.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda va a comprar productos de primera necesidad, semillas y fertilizantes para el negocio de su marido. Lleva más de  3 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es darles la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: The Mejorando El Future (Improving the Future) Community Bank meets at a place called Tierras Amarillas (Yellow Lands) in the hamlet of Rocafuerte every 15 days. This area is known for its agriculture since a large number of its inhabitants make a living in short-cycle farming. It is here we find María, a 34-year-old married mother of four children, ages 17, 13, 11 and 7. Two of her children are in high school and the youngest is in elementary school. Her husband is a farmer. With the help of her first loan María received from the community bank, she stocked a small convenience store in her home, selling all kinds of products like rice, sugar, oils, detergents, legumes, vegetables and fruits. She works every day from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m., even later at times. Her husband helps her once in a while. She has had her business for a year and despite the limited time she has many customers since there are not very many stores in her area. María also will give part of her loan to her husband for rice and corn seeds. She is going to use this loan to better stock her store with products of primary necessity, and for seeds and fertilizers for her husband's business. She has had more than three loan cycles with the community bank and likes it for helping provide the loans. Her dream is to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras De Micaela Bastidas Group

texts.es: La señora Reyna de 48 años de edad pertenese a la alcancia comunal Mujeres Triunfadoras de Micaela Bastidas, un grupo de 7 integrantes  que se caracterisa por el empeño y la dedicacion en sus negocios con un solo objetivo que es el salir adelante por el bien de sus familias. Reyna tiene un hijo aun menor de edad por lo cual se da tiempo entre cuidarlo y poder  trabajar en la venta de ropa, lleva ya mas de cuatro años en este negocio que inicio con su hermana a raiz de que no habian  suficientes ingresos para sustentar su hogar. Con este trabajo a podido lograr solventar gastos que cubren pagos como los del colegio de su hijo. En el futuro le gustaria tener otra tienda y poner la venta de ropa para bebes. Con el reciente prestamo lo piensa invertir en comprar de prendas de vestir
texts.en:
Reyna, 48, belongs to the Mujeres Triunfadoras de Micaela Bastidas communal bank, a group of seven members who are characterized by their effort and dedication in their businesses with a single objective, to get ahead for the well-being of their families.

Reyna has a son who is still a minor, so she divides her time between caring for him and being able to work selling clothing.  She has been doing this business for more than four years.  She started it with her sister because they didn't have enough income to support their household.  She has been able to pay some expenses with this job, including her son's school expenses.  In the future she would like to have another store and sell baby clothing.

She plans to invest the recent loan in buying clothing.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Ren's Group

texts.en:
Ren, a 69-year-old widow, lives with her six children in a rural village located in the Dambae district of Cambodia. She has struggled her life to feed her children as a widow by planting cassava, farming rice and planting water melon. She has been in the rice farming business for 25 years and in cassava and water melon business for 10 years. Her main challenge is the drop in the price of cassava. 

Ren’s group consists of two female members and she is in the seventh loan cycle with VisionFund while her member is in the fifth. The past loans from VisionFund have helped her extend her farmland. Currently, she is able to earn around 37,500 KHR per day to spend on daily expenses. With a good business, she is leading her group to apply for another loan of 4,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will use part of her portion to plant rubber as another business for her family and use the remaining portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her business and earn a larger income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana es una joven emprendedora de 20 años que desde hace aproximadamente 3 años aprendió la actividad de la marquetería y consiguió trabajo con un conocido. Posteriormente, montó su propio taller y desde entonces viene trabajando fuertemente para generar ingresos con los cuales se puede sostener sus propios gastos y contribuye económicamente para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Hace año y medio que tiene su propio taller y gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos ha logrado captar una gran cantidad de clientes, lo que le permite tener muy buenas ventas en su negocio. Con el ánimo de responder a los grandes pedidos de sus clientes, Liliana busca que un préstamo le permita comprar insumos y materias primas que requiere como madera, moldes, pegamento, entre otros, para responder a los pedidos de sus clientes.

De esta manera su negocio seguirá saliendo adelante y así seguirá generando ingresos para su hogar. Además, con mejores ingresos espera que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar. Su sueño es seguir creciendo con su taller y algún día poder tener un gran taller donde pueda generar empleo y sea reconocida en muchas partes por su buen trabajo.
texts.en:
Liliana is a young entrepreneur who is 20 years old. About three years ago, she learned the craft of marquetry and got a job working with an acquaintance. Later on, she set up her own shop, and has been working hard ever since in order to generate income to support herself and contribute financially to cover home expenses.
She has had her own shop for a year and a half, and thanks to the good quality of her products, she has been able to gain a great number of customers, which allows her business' sales to go very well. Hoping to respond to her customers' large orders, Liliana is seeking a loan so that she can purchase the input and raw materials that she needs, such as wood, molds, glue, and other items, in order to respond to her customers' orders.
This way, her business will keep moving forward and she will continue to generate income for her household. Also, she hopes better income will allow her family to have a better quality of life and greater financial opportunities for progress.
Her dream is for her shop to continue growing and some day have a large workshop where she may create jobs and be broadly known for her good work.

loans.use: to purchase the input and raw materials she needs, such as wood, molds, glue, and others, and to respond to her customers' orders.

loans.name: Agenor

texts.es:
Agenor tiene 31 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos como carga familiar. Vive en casa propia hace mas de 6 años puesto que antes vivía en casa de padres a unos cuantos metros.  Agenor y su familia residen en el Caserío El Porvenir Hualtaco III del Distrito de Tambogrande. Cliente vive en la parte rural  de este distrito y cuenta con servicio básico de luz eléctrica solamente.

La actividad que desarrolla Agenor es la agrícola como actividad principal y la crianza de ovinos y aves de corral como actividad complementaria, esta actividad la desarrolla desde hace mas de 6 años.  Paralelamente cuenta con  0,5 has de terreno agrícola sembrados de limón, los cuales fueron heredados por su padre. Su esposa cría aves de corral y lo apoya en toda  actividad que realiza. Además Agenor cuenta con ingresos extras ya que labora como obrero en una fábrica.  
 
Agenor quiere comprar abono para la mejor cosecha del limón, mejoras en baño de vivienda, arreglos en el techo de la misma, mejoras en corral de animales, esto para seguir creciendo en su negocio lo cual le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida, ante ello está solicitando un préstamo de S/. 4,500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Agenor is 31 years old, married, and has two children.  He has lived in a home of his own for more than six years.  Before that he lived at his parents’ home a few meters away.  Agenor and his family live in the El Porvenir Hualtaco III settlement within the Tambogrande district.  He lives in the rural part of this district and has only basic electrical services.

Agenor farms and also raises sheep and corral birds.  He has been doing this for more than six years and has half an hectare of farmland, inherited from his father, where he raises lemons.  His wife raises corral birds and supports him in everything he does.  Agenor also has extra income, since he also works in a factory. 
 
Agenor wants to buy fertilizer to improve his lemon crop.  He also wants to make improvements to the bathroom in his home and make some repairs to his roof and to his animal pen.  This will help him continue growing his business and improve his quality of life.  He is asking for a loan of 4,500 PEN.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Kimsan

texts.en:
Kimsan is 60 years old and a married mother of four children. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Ponhea Krek district where crop farming is a common way to earn a living. She is a rice farmer who has been in this business for several years, and she supplements her income by buying and selling fertilizers and dry fish. With her current source of income, she is able to earn around 39,500 KHR per day to spend on daily expenses. 

This is the first loan for Kimsan with VisionFund. To support her business, she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for sale and use a portion of it to spend on rice farming. She hopes to make more rice and earn income from her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for sale and spend on rice farming

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Heang's Group

texts.en:
Heang has five dependent children and lives in Dambae district of Cambodia. She has worked as a paid worker for 20 years. Raising pigs for sale is her other source of income. Her family struggles when their children and/or pigs get sick. Heang has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles and is now leading a group of two female members to apply another loan after her previous loans have been paid. 

As the leader, Heang will use her portion to buy more piglets and the feed for piglets. Through this loan, she hopes the pigs will not get sick by the time they are big enough for sale and that she can make more money to provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed for piglets.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 60 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico y de corte tradicional, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos.  Vive junto con su familia en casa propia en el distrito de Mórrope, perteneciente a la provincia de Lambayeque, se encuentra ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Oscar tiene en la parte posterior de su casa corrales en los cuales cría animales menores tales como pavos, patos, pallos, etc. También cría ganado caprino y porcino. Adicionalmente recibe una pensión como guardián del centro de salud de su localidad.  Con los ingresos que obtiene de las actividades que realiza cubre sus costos y los de su familia.

Oscar desea adquirir alimento para mejorar la calidad de crianza de sus animales y obtener una mejor producción que le permita seguir adelante con su negocio, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Oscar presenta buenas referencias personales.
texts.en:
Oscar is 60 years old. He lives in his own house, which is constructed from basic materials in a traditional style. He is in a common-law marriage and has three children. He lives with his family in his own house in the district of Mórrope, which belongs to the province of Lambayeque, which is located an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Behind his house Oscar has corrals where he raises small animals such as turkeys, ducks, chickens, etc. He also raises livestock such as goats and pigs. In addition, he receives a pension as watchman at the health center in his district. With the income that he obtains from his activities, he covers his expenses and those of his family.

Oscar wants to acquire feed to improve the raising of his animals and obtain better production, which will permit him to move forward with his business. For that reason he has seen the need to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 PEN, which will help him to reach his goal.

Oscar presents good personal references.

loans.use: to acquire balanced feed to improve the raising of his animals

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras De Laderas De Chillon Group

texts.es: El Sr. Jesús tiene 49 años. El es un prospero comerciante que se dedica a la confección de calzados, empezó en este rubro hace 15 años debido a la inestabilidad laboral que existía por ese entonces los trabajos eran cortos  y despedían mucha gente, un amigo lo recomendó para trabajar en una empresa de calzados donde permaneció por muchos años fue allí donde aprendió todo lo referente a la elaboración de zapatos y zapatillas, por su cuenta también se preparo estudiando y llevando cursos para perfeccionarse. Con toda la experiencia ganada opto por abrir su propio negocio hoy en día es fabricante de calzados al por mayor y es proveedor de varias tiendas, gracias a su trabajo tiene una casa propia y un carro que le permiten seguir adelante, también le ha permitido darle a su familia estabilidad económica, actualmente  junto a su esposa han iniciado un nuevo negocio una fuente de soda donde han invertido sus ahorros, para mas adelante quiere ampliar su casa para alquilar locales. El Sr. Jesús es el presidente de la alcancía recién formada “MUJERES TRABAJADORAS DE LADERAS DE CHILLON”  espera junto a su grupo seguir progresando, con su préstamo recibido comprara los insumos que necesita para su negocio como pegamento y cueros.
texts.en: Jesus is 49 years old and a successful merchant and shoemaker.  He began doing this type of work 15 years ago because of the unstable labor market, which at that time meant that jobs were short and many people were let go.  A friend recommended him to work at a shoe company where he remained for many years, and there he learned to make shoes and slippers.  He also studied on his own and took classes to improve himself.  With all of his experience, he opted to open his own business and today he makes shoes in quantity and supplies various stores.  Thanks to his work he has a home of his own and a car which allows him continue moving ahead.  It has also permitted him to provide financial stability to his family.  He and his wife have started a new business; a soda fountain in which they have invested their savings.  Later they want to expand their home so they can rent out space to merchants.  Jesus is the president of the newly formed “MUJERES TRABAJADORAS DE LADERAS DE CHILLON” communal bank.  He hopes to continue getting ahead with his group and with a loan that he will use to buy supplies that he needs for his business, such as glue and leather.

loans.use: to buy glue and leather.

loans.name: Ramón Alfredo

texts.es:
En una localidad llamada Tierras Amarillas del cantón Rocafuerte cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Mejorando El Futuro, este sector es conocido por su agricultura ya que gran parte de sus habitantes se dedican a los sembríos de ciclo corto.

En este lugar vive Don Ramón, tiene  56 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, uno es mayor de edad y el menor tiene 12 años el cual estudia en escuela. La mujer se dedica a la casa. 

Nuestro amigo se dedica tanto a la agricultura como también a realizar trabajos de soldadura, pues tiene un taller en el cual en temporadas y cuando les salen obras se dedica a realizar obras con el metal, él fabrica puertas, ventanas y otras cosas en su taller. También se dedica a sus cultivos y es justo para eso que solicito este crédito pues él tenía sembrado arroz, maíz y verduras los mismos que se le perdieron por lo duro del invierno, ahora espera con este crédito volver a sembrar y recuperar lo que se le perdió.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar fertilizantes y pagar la mano de obra de los sembríos.  Él recién empezó en el Banco Comunal, pero su mujer estaba desde el inicio pero como ella enfermó ahora él fue el que realizo el crédito que siempre ha sido para su trabajo.
 
Sus sueños son que su mujer se recupere y que la cosecha sea muy buena para recuperar lo perdido.
texts.en: The Mejorando El Future (Improving the Future) Community Bank meets at a place called Tierras Amarillas (Yellow Lands) in the hamlet of Rocafuerte every 15 days. This area is known for its agriculture since a large number of its inhabitants make a living in short-cycle farming. It is here we find Ramón, a 56-year-old married father of two children, one who is grown up and the youngest who is 12 and in school. His partner is a housewife. Ramón makes a living as much in farming as he does in soldering, since he has a workshop where he works with metal, making doors, windows and other items. He also dedicates himself to his crops and it's for this reason he is requesting the loan since he had planted rice, corn and vegetables, which he lost during the hard winter, and now he hopes with this loan to replant and recuperate what he lost. He just started with the community bank, but his wife has been with it from the start, but since she has become ill he now is requesting a loan, which was always used for his work. His dreams are for his wife to get better and for his harvest to go very well to recover what he lost.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Las Samaritanas De Xequemeya Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria esta casada, tiene 39 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 8 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica al comercio, a la venta de ropa en las plazas, inicio este negocio con poco capital y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo de mujeres para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería, blusas, suéteres, sabanas, delantales, cortes, fajas, etc. Espera tener un negocio bien surtido y con mucho capital. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedica al comercio, crianza de animales y a la agricultura.
texts.en: Maria is married, 39 years old and never had the chance to go to school. She has eight children who are in school. She makes a living in commerce, selling clothing in the plazas. She started the business with little capital and at the moment has five years of experience. She is organizing a group of women to request a loan that she plans to use use to purchase supplies like blouses, sweaters, sheets, aprons, shorts, sashes, etc. She hopes to have her business well stocked and with a lot of capital. The other members of the group make a living in commerce, raising livestock and in farming.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Vicenta Regina

texts.es:
La señora Vicenta Regina esta casada, tiene 21 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 1 hijo, se dedica a la tejeduría, inicio este negocio con sus padres, y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia.

solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de varios colores y así mejorar su produccion de tejido. Espera en el futuro tener un negocio grande y con trabajadores.
texts.en:
Señora Vicenta Regina is married. She is 21 years old. She went to school for three years of primary education. She has one son. She works in the knittng business. She began this business with her parents, and up to now she has had 10 years of experience.

She is applying for a loan that she will use to by yarn of various colors and thus improve her knitting production. She hopes in the future to have a big business with workers.

loans.use: to buy yarn for knitting.

loans.name: Hor's Group

texts.en:
Hor, 27, is married with one son who depends on her. To make a living for the last five years, she has been farming rice as the only source of her family’s income. The main challenge for her family’s business is a lack of working capital to increase her business activity. 

Hor’s group consists of three members who live in the same village located in the Prey Chhor district. This is the second loan for Hor with VisionFund; other members have been with VisionFund for both this cycle and another year. The first loan helped Hor afford decent clothing and build some savings. Currently, she manages to earn around 12500 KHR per day and is able to save around 4000 KHR each day. 

Now requesting a loan with VisionFund, Hor (the group's leader) will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and pay for plowing labor. She hopes to increase her crop yield to make a better living and build more savings for the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
La señora Adela tiene 55 años de edad es casada y tiene cinco hijos. Desde hace 40 años se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas y maíz.  A pesar de ser una señora con bastantes años, ella tiene una energía muy grande, pues para llegar al terreno donde tiene sus cultivos tiene que caminar por unas colinas muy inclinadas. Adela aprendió el oficio de la agricultura con su papá ya que era lo único que sabia hacer. 
Para comprar los insumos agrícolas, ella debe caminar por un callejón pedregoso hasta llegar a la calle principal de la comunidad donde aborda un autobús el cual viaja durante cuarenta y cinco minutos hasta llegar a la ciudad. 
El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 12 sacos de fertilizantes que cuestan $56 dólares cada uno, dos galones de herbicidas y semilla de maíz, para sembrar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 3,500 metros cuadrados de pipían. Lo que ella quiere es comprar todos los insumos de una sola vez, para evitar tanto viaje al pueblo a comprar por poquitos y obtener una rebaja. Además que aplicara de forma oportuna todos los insumos a su cultivo y obtendrá una mayor producción e ingresos. 
Ella desea ahorrar para comprarse unas dos vacas lecheras y obtener el alimento diario para su familia.
texts.en:
Adela is 55 years old, married, and has five children.  For the past 40 years she has been raising vegetables and corn.  Even though she is an older woman, she has lots of energy and she must walk up some steep hills to reach her crops.  Adela learned the farming trade from her father because it was the only thing he knew how to do.  To buy her supplies, she needs to walk through a stony alley to reach the main street in the city, where she boards a bus and travels 45 minutes until reaching the city.


She is requesting a loan through Fundación Campo in order to buy 12 sacks of fertilizer, which cost $56 each, two gallons of herbicide, and corn seed, in order to plant 14,000 square meters or corn and 3,500 square meters of pipían.  What she wants to do is buy all of her supplies at the same time so that she can get them for a discount and also doesn’t have to make so many trips into town to buy a little at a time.  She also wants to apply them to all of her crops at once to get a better production and income.


She wants to save up to buy two dairy cows so she can obtain daily milk for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: José Ronaldo

texts.es:
El Señor  José Ronaldo es originario del municipio de El Sauce, se dedica al pequeño comercio desde hace muchos años donde tiene gran experiencia en el ramo del comercio.
Su negocio consiste en la venta de carne de cerdo ubicado en su casa de habitación, negocio que le ha permitido salir adelante en preparar a sus hijos los cuales hoy son independientes, construir su propia vivienda y comprar sus bienes como vehículos los cuales le sirven para realizar sus gestiones de trabajo.
Debido a la gran demanda de este producto por la temporada necesita un crédito para adquirir cerdos para su respectivo destace por lo cual está solicitando su cuarto crédito para llevar a cabo su objetivo y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
Espera y confía en Dios que su solicitud sea aprobada para poder cumplir su objetivo ya que necesita este crédito como capital de trabajo, ya que ofrece crédito a sus clientes.
texts.en:
José Ronaldo is from the municipality of El Sauce.  He’s been a small businessman for many years and has quite a bit of experience in his line of work.

His business consists in selling pork from home, a business that has allowed him to get ahead and to prepare his children who are now independent, to build his own house and to buy assets like vehicles that are useful for him to do his business transactions.

Due to the high demand of his product this season he needs a loan to buy pigs to butcher which is why he’s asking for his fourth loan to reach his objective and satisfy customer demand.  

He hopes and trusts in God that his application will be approved so that he can reach his objective because he needs this loan as working capital because he sells to his customers on credit.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Xiomara Abigahil

texts.es:
Xiomara Abigahil es una joven sauceña que se dedica a su hogar, labora como Farmacéutica y estudia una carrera universitaria acorde a su trabajo ya que quiere prepararse profesionalmente para tener  un mejor futuro y por ende tener mejores ingresos para un mejor mañana.
Una de las necesidades que tiene esta joven es solicitar un crédito para pagar los gastos de la universidad y no tener ningún impedimento para culminar su carrera, ya que con su pequeño salario muchas veces no se pueden cubrir estos gastos por lo que estos créditos vienen a ayudar al desarrollo económico del asalariado.
Espera cumplir su sueño para poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar y poder construir su propia vivienda con todas sus condiciones.
texts.en:
Xiomara Abigahil is a young woman from El Sauce who is devoted to her home.  She works as a pharmacist and is studying a university career that’s in step with her work because she wants to prepare herself professionally to have a better future and as a result earn better income for a better tomorrow.

One of the needs this young woman has is a loan to pay for her university costs and not have any impediment towards completing her career because her small salary sometimes is insufficient to cover these costs so the loans end up helping the economic development of salaried employees.

She hopes to make her dream a reality and to be able to help her husband with household expenses and to be able to build her own house with all its conditions.

loans.use: to pay university costs.

loans.name: Paz Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Paz del Carmen es una Sauceña que se dedica al pequeño comercio donde su negocio consiste en la venta de ropa variada y sandalias el cual tiene varios años de tenerlo y el que le ha permitido obtener sus propios ingresos para preparar a sus hijos como madre soltera y luchadora.
Inició con capital propio el cual fue obtenido como ahorro de muchos años de laborar como costurera para luego poner este negocio el que ha ido creciendo poco a poco por la buena a tención a sus clientes y calidad de la ropa y zapatos.
En la actualidad necesita de capital para ampliar el negocio con respecto a variedad de ropa y zapatos por lo que está solicitando el préstamo No 14 para comprar blusas, pantalones y sandalias con el fin de satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
Cabe señalar que esta señora tiene siete años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde le han otorgado 14 créditos todos para su desarrollo económico porque gracias a estos financiamientos ha mantenido por muchos años su negocio, esperando seguir con esta relación con dicha Institución.
texts.en:
Paz del Carmen is a woman from El Sauce who is a small businesswoman; her business consists of selling assorted clothing.  She’s had it for several years and it’s allowed her to earn her own income to prepare her children since she’s a tenacious, single mother.

She started out with her own income that she got from saving up during the many years she worked as a seamstress to then open this business that’s been growing bit by bit thanks to the good customer service and the quality of the clothes and shoes.

She currently needs capital to expand the business with regard to the variety of clothes and shoes which is why she’s asking for loan #14 to buy blouses, pants and sandals to satisfy customer demand.

It’s worth mentioning that this woman has been working with Ceprodel for seven years and she’s been granted 14 loans for her economic development because thanks to these loans she’s stayed in business for many years; she hopes to continue this relationship with said Institution.

loans.use: to buy clothes and sandals.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino tiene 27 años de edad, vive junto con su esposa y 2 de sus menores hijos en casa propia de material rustico y de corte tradicional.  Dentro de su ambiente familiar, de condiciones humildes se aprecia bastante voluntad para realizar sus actividades laborales y en su comunidad se aprecia la cooperación entre vecinos. Su comunidad es netamente rural con 30 familias en promedio, cuyos pobladores se dedican principalmente a la crianza de animales menores, ganado vacuno, porcino, caprino y ovino, además de cultivar productos como maíz, menestras y cereales como el arroz.

Marcelino en la parte posterior de su casa tiene corrales en los cuales cría animales menores tales como pavos, patos, pollos, etc.,  también cría ganado caprino y ovino. Actividad que desarrolla hace 10 años aproximadamente.  Con los ingresos que percibe cubre sus costos y los de su familia.

Marcelino desea comprar alimento balanceado para animales además de comprar animales menores con fines de engorde para posteriormente venderlos.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para lograr su objetivo.

Marcelino presenta buenas referencias personales como comerciales.
texts.en:
Marcelino, 27, lives with his wife and two of his minor children in his own house made from insubstantial materials and in a traditional style.  Within the family environment, conditions are humble; one appreciates much will to work and in his community cooperation among neighbors is noted.  His community is completely rural with an average of 30 families.  The residents mainly work raising small farm animals, cattle, pigs, goats and sheep; they also grow such things as corn, vegetables and cereals like rice.

Marcelino has corrals in the rear of his house where he raises small animals like turkeys, ducks, chickens, etc.  He also raises goats and sheep, an activity he’s been doing for approximately ten years.  With income earned he’s able to cover his and his family’s expenses.

Marcelino wants to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed and also to buy small farm animals to fatten up and subsequently sell which is why he’s felt it advisable to obtain a 1500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to reach his goal.   Marcelino has good personal and commercial references.

loans.use: to buy farm animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a resident of Murang’a in Central Kenya where she lives with her family of  four children - two of whom are adults and the other two are juniors who are still in school. She has been farming for 20 years  and currently runs her farm with the help of one farmhand. She sells her produce of milk  mainly to the Brookside Dairies Company.

Agnes has made a loan request of 84,800 KES from Kiva's partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says her  years of experience in dairy farming has enabled her to know the benefits of growing quality breeds of dairy cows and general management of dairy farming. She hopes to earn more income and improve the general living standards of her family and educate her two children who are still in school.

She notes instability in milk prices and access to farming capital as the leading challenges to smallholder farmers. However, she is glad Juhudi Kilimo's services are now available to farmers.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric and embroidery thread.

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.ru: Дилрабо замужняя женщина, на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Она талантливая и воспитанная женщина, которая торгует на рынке более 7 лет. В основном она занимается купле- продажей национальных изделий на центральном рынке. Имеет много клиентов и большой спрос на рынке, так как во время проведения мероприятий все покупают национальные изделия. Дилрабо хотела бы получить займ для покупки товара с целью расширения бизнеса. Она надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en:
Dilrabo is a married woman who is raising two children. Talented and educated, she has worked as a market vendor for more than 7 years. 

Dilrabo mostly buys and sells traditional Tajik manufactured articles at the central market.  She has a large number of customers and the demand at the market is high, since everyone buys traditional articles for various events.

Dilrabo would like to get a loan to purchase some merchandise which will allow her to expand her business. She looks forward to your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy traditional manufactured articles to expand her business.

loans.name: Kour's Group

texts.en:
Kour is 48 years old and married. She has two children, one of who is under her responsibility and working in a garment factory. Rice farming is the only source of income for her family. She has been farming for almost 25 years. With her current business, she is able to earn around 16,000 KHR per day to spend for daily expenses. 

This is the first loan for Kour with VisionFund while her group member has been with VisionFund for one cycle already. She is leading her group of two to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay for labor in plowing. She hopes to make more rice so that she can earn more income and increase her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland and pay for labor.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Rina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Desde hace 18 años atras doña Rina cuenta con una pulperia que le permite ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de su familia. Ella y su familia viven en la Colonia Rivas Montes, en la ciudad de Juticalpa, departamento de Olancho. Doña Rina inició vendiendo solamente refrescos, charamuscas y chocobananos, y poco a poco con lo que le quedaba de sus ventas diarias fue invirtiendo para hacer crecer su pulperia. Ella atiende su pulperia sola y cuando sus hijos tienen tiempo libre le ayudan. 

Doña Rina solicita este prestamo para la compra de embutidos, lacteos, carnes, maseca, arroz, pastas, escobas, shampoos, acondicionadores, desodorantes, refrescos, jugos, verduras, entre otros productos. Con el apoyo de este prestamo su pulperia estará mejor surtida y sus clientes siempre encontraran lo que necesiten.

Su meta es tener un mini-mercadito, poder ampliar el local del negocio y contratar a un empleado para que la ayude a atenderlo, y asi ella podra atender a su familia y en un futuro cercano tener otro negocio mas.

Este es su ciclo 9 en FAMA y por dos ocasiones ha sido premiada por ser una cliente puntual con sus pagos.
texts.en:
For the past 18 years, Rina has had a small grocery store which allows her to help her husband support the family. She lives with her family in Colonia Rivas Montes, within the city of Juticalpa, in the department of Olancho. Rina started out selling only soft drinks, frozen juice bags, and frozen chocolate bananas, and little by little she reinvested what was left over from her daily sales to expand her business. She works at the grocery store by herself, and her children help her when they have free time.

Rina is requesting this loan in order to purchase cold cuts, dairy products, meat, Maseca, rice, pasta, brooms, shampoos, conditioners, deodorants, soft drinks, fruit juices, vegetables, and other products. With the support of this loan, her store will be better stocked and her customers will always find what they need.

Her goal is to have a mini-mart, to be able to expand the business premises, and hire an employee to help her, so that she can tend to her family and in the near future open another business. 

This is her 9th cycle with FAMA and she has twice been awarded for making her payments timely.

loans.use: to purchase groceries in general.

loans.name: Gloria Moncerrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Productivo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Gloria, tiene 42 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, uno mayor y los menores de 16 y 14 años de edad los mismos que estudian en universidad y los menores en colegio. El marido se dedica a la pesca.
 
Nuestra amiga  es una mujer que le encanta ganar sus propios recursos para lo cual se dedica a la preparación y venta de corviches y empanadas, nos cuenta que todos los días ella fabrica 200 corviches y 200 empanadas las mismas que entrega a comerciantes que luego los llevan a su negocios y allí las revenden a sus clientes, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 16h00 y lleva más de 5 años realizando esta labor la cual le ha dejado muy buenos ingresos.
  
Este crédito es para comprar maní, plátano, pescado y otros ingredientes necesarios en la fabricación de sus productos. Lleva cinco  ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta la rapidez con que salen los créditos, además porque termina uno y comienzan con otro sin pérdida de tiempo.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Productivo communal bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi settlement, known nationally and internationally for its rich pre-Columbian culture and for its arts.  It’s the place of the famous straw hats.  
 

Gloria lives here.  She is 42 years old and in a live in relationship.  They have three children, one adult and the others ages 16 and 14.  The oldest studies at university and the younger ones attend school.  Her husband is a fisherman.
 

Our friend is a lady who loves to earn her own income and prepares and sells her own corviches and empanadas.  She says that she makes 200 corviches and 200 empanadas which she provides to merchants who then take them to their places of business and resell them to their customers.  She works every day from 8:00 am to 4:00 pm and has been doing this for more than five years.  It provides her a good income.
 

She will use the money from this loan to buy peanuts, banana, fish, and other necessary ingredients to make her products.  She has been with the communal bank for five cycles and she enjoys the quick turnaround of the loans and also that as soon as one is paid off, she can get another without losing time.


Her dreams are to continue moving forward in her business and for her children to establish themselves in professional careers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Zorayda Beatriz

texts.es:
Zorayda Beatriz es una sauceña dedicada a su trabajo el cual consiste en brindar servicio como Farmacéutica con muchos años de experiencia.
Su objetivo principal en la vida y la de su esposo es preparar a su hija profesionalmente para que se defienda en la vida en un futuro, por lo que actualmente necesita un crédito para pagar lo módulos para tramitar el título de universidad.
Por tal razón se acercó por primera vez a Ceprodel para solicitar su primer crédito para pagar estos gastos que al final es una herencia que se deja a los hijos para que sean independientes y se defiendan solos en la vida.
Confía en Dios salir adelante y cumplir con esta obligación para tener una relación duradera con Ceprodel y que le sigan apoyando para tener un mejor desarrollo económico.
texts.en:
Zorayda Beatriz is from El Sauce and she’s dedicated to her work which consists in providing pharmacy services; she has many years’ experience.

The main objective in her and her husband’s lives is to prepare their daughter professionally so that she can fend for herself in life in the future which is why she currently needs a loan to pay for the modules leading to her university degree.

For this reason she approached Ceprodel for the first time to request her first loan to pay these costs which in the real scheme of things is a legacy she leaves for the children so that they will be independent and able to fend for themselves in life.

She trusts in God that she will move forward and be able to meet this obligation in order to have a long-lasting relationship with Ceprodel and that they will continue supporting her to have a better economic development.

loans.use: to pay for university.

loans.name: Juana María

texts.es:
La Señora  Juana María es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, es madre soltera de dos hijos la que se ha dedicado con esmero a educarlos de la mejor manera, Se desempeña como maestra de primaria con muchos años de experiencia. 
Una de las necesidades que tiene esta señora es adquirir un préstamo para invertirlo en su vivienda con el cual comprará ladrillos, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra.
Espera y confía en Dios que su solicitud sea aprobada para llevar a cabo su objetivo, cumplir su sueño de ver su casita con todas las condiciones adecuadas para dejar un buen futuro para sus hijos.
Tiene tres años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde le han otorgado tres créditos para su desarrollo económico y agradece mucho a esta Institución por el apoyo brindado a las personas salariadas.
texts.en:
Juana María is from the municipality of El Sauce.  She’s a single mother of two children that she’s striven with much dedication to educate in the best way possible.  She works as an elementary school teacher and has many years’ experience.

One of the needs this woman faces is to acquire a loan to invest in her home; she will buy bricks, cement, sand and pay labor costs.

She hopes and trusts in God that her application will be approved in order to reach her objective and make her dream of seeing her house have all necessary conditions to leave a good future for her children.

She’s been working with Ceprodel for three years and she’s been granted three loans for her economic development.  She is very grateful to this Institution for the support provided to salaried people.

loans.use: to buy building supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos dependientes. Vive en casa propia, la cual se encuentra ubicada en el Distrito de Tambogrande. Cuenta con servicios básicos de luz y agua.
La actividad que desarrolla Eva es la venta de abarrotes, bebidas y golosinas, hace un poco más de 7 años. Atendiendo todos los días en su propio domicilio, para lo cual cuenta con clientela establecida. También cuenta con negocio de abarrotes en Mercado de Tambogrande, donde registra más venta, pues entrega al por mayor. El negocio en el mercado es atendido por su esposo.  Eva y su esposo cuenta con buen nivel de inventario en ambos negocios. 
Eva con el anhelo de seguir ofreciendo mayor gama de productos en su negocio ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de S/. 2,500 con lo que comprará más mercadería en abarrotes como (arroz, azúcar, aceites, etc)..
texts.en:
Eva, 34, is married and has two dependent children. She lives in her own home, which is located in the district of Tambogrande. She has basic electric and water services.

Eva works in the business of selling groceries, drinks and candy. She has done so for a little over 7 years. Every day, she provides service in her own home for her established clients. She also has a grocery business at the Tambogrande market, where she sells additional products wholesale. The business at the market is serviced by her husband. Eva and her husband have a good inventory in both businesses. 

Eva has decided to request a loan of 2,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa so she can continue to offer a wide range of products in her business. With this loan, she will buy grocery merchandise such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, and other products.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La Señora  Flora es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, es madre de cuatro hijos de los cuales solamente uno tiene a su cargo, cuenta con su propio negocio el cual consiste en la venta de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, maíz, sorgo y verduras ubicada en la Terminal de buses de dicho municipio contando con mucho años de experiencia y trabajando en conjunto con su esposo.
Desde que inició su negocio se ha caracterizado por dar una buena atención a sus clientes y gracias al esfuerzo propio ha podido diversificarlo en productos y a bajos precios lo que atrae la atención de los mismos, también le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia y adquirir su propia vivienda. Una de las necesidades que tiene esta señora es contar con más capital para adquirir más granos y verduras para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, por tal razón decidió solicitar su octavo crédito en Ceprodel con el objetivo de satisfacer dicha demanda.
Espera salir adelante con su negocio y seguir trabajando con Ceprodel por muchos años más.
texts.en:
Flora is from the municipality of El Sauce.  She’s the mother of four children of which only one is still in her care.  She has her own business which is selling basic grains like rice, beans, corn, sorghum and vegetables located at the bus terminal in said town.  She has many years’ experience and works together with her husband.

Since she started her business she’s been noted for giving good customer service and thanks to her own efforts has been able to diversify her products and the low prices attract customers.  It has also allowed her to move her family forward and to acquire her own house.

One of her needs is to have more capital to acquire more grains and vegetables to satisfy customer demand which is why she requested her 8th Ceprodel loan with the objective of satisfying said demand.  She hopes to move ahead with her business and to continue working with Ceprodel for many more years.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
María Isabel Vive en el municipio de El Sauce, Es Acompañada tiene 2 hijos a su cargo  trabaja actual mente en su propio negocio, el cual consiste en una pequeña pulpería y refrescos en su propia casa de habitación  ya que es por segunda vez que está solicitando crédito con nuestra institución, donde tiene dos años de tener su negocio.

El destino del crédito es para darle un mejor surtido a su negocio, comprando producto varios donde esto le permitirá obtener mejor ganancia diaria y sus ventas se han con una mejor rentabilidad. 
Esto le permitirá mantener en mejores condiciones el bien estar de su familia.
texts.en:
María Isabel lives in the municipality of El Sauce. She has a spouse and two children in her care.  She currently works in her own business that consists in a small grocery store and refreshments at home.  This is the second time she’s asking for a loan from out institution; she’s had her business for two years.

The loan will be used to better stock her store buying assorted products which will allow her to obtain better daily profits and her sales will be more profitable which will make it possible for her to maintain better conditions for her family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy assorted merchandise.

loans.name: Sonia Eudina

texts.es: Doña Sonia es casada, tiene 50 años de edad, tiene 6 hijos,  ella es una persona muy amable, servicial y alegre, y tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación. Hace quince años comenzó vendiendo productos como ser: azúcar, arroz, y otros productos de uso domestico, luego fue surtiendo su negocio con otros productos que los mismos clientes le recomendaban vender. Inicio a trabajar por cuenta propia y en el transcurso del tiempo aprendió a manejar su negocio. Hace aproximadamente 5 años incorporo a su negocio la venta de ropa y útiles escolares, su horario de atención inicia a partir de las 6:00 a.m y culmina a las 7:00 p.m. Sonia solicita este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de calzado, ropa de diferentes estilos y que esten a la moda. Con el apoyo de este préstamo podrá surtir su negocio y seguir teniendo una fuente de ingresos para poder apoyar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de su familia. Su meta es mantener su negocio activo y una familia feliz. Doña Sonia tiene 6 ciclos de recibir el apoyo de FAMA mediante los préstamos obtenidos y ha mantenido un  buen comportamiento de pago.
texts.en:
Sonia is 50 years old, married, and has six children. She is a very kind, helpful, and cheerful person, and she has a small grocery store in her home. Fifteen years ago, she started off selling products such as sugar, rice, and other household items. She later stocked her business with other products, which her customers recommended that she sell. She started working on her own and over time she learned how to manage her business. About five years ago, she added the sale of clothing and school supplies to her business. Her schedule of operation starts at 6am and ends at 7pm. 

Sonia is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of shoes, and different styles of clothing which are in fashion. With the support of this loan, she will be able to restock her business and continue to have a source of income so that she can help her husband support the family. Her goal is to maintain an active business and a happy family. Sonia has participated in six loan cycles with FAMA and demonstrated a good payment history with the loans she has received.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
El Joven Israel Actualmente desempeña el cargo de Técnico, es una persona  con espíritu de superación, siempre aspira por vivir en mejores condiciones se dio la oportunidad de conocer a Ceprodel que apoyaba a este tipo de actividad. 

Por esta razón,  se presentó para solicitar un crédito para la compra de zinc y Perlinas para el mejoramiento del techo de su vivienda, debido a que ha sido afectado por fenómenos naturales que ha enfrentado esto lo hace con el objetivo de brindarle un mejor hogar a su familia.
texts.en:
Israel currently works as a technician. He is a person with a spirit for overcoming obstacles, and he always aspires to live in better conditions. He was given the opportunity to become familiar with Ceprodel, which helps with this type of activity.

For this reason, Israel came and requested a loan to buy zinc and purlins to improve his home's roof, since it has been affected by natural phenomena that have occurred. He is making these improvements with the purpose of giving his family a better home.

loans.use: to buy zinc and purlins

loans.name: Editha Judith

texts.es:
En una localidad llamada Tierras Amarillas del cantón Rocafuerte cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Mejorando El Futuro, este sector es conocido por su agricultura ya que gran parte de sus habitantes se dedican a los sembríos de ciclo corto.

En este lugar vive la señora Editha, tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija de 11 años de edad,  la misma que   estudia en  colegio. El marido se dedica a la agricultura.
 
Nuestra amiga trabaja en sociedad con uno de sus hermanos, se dedican a la agricultura y nos cuenta que ellos siempre siembran cultivos de arroz, maíz y verduras, ella se encarga de realizar los créditos con los cuales financian estos cultivos mientras que su hermano es quien se dedica a los trabajos en el campo junto con dos personas más a quienes les pagan por su trabajo, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que recién están en el periodo de siembras ya que lo que tenían sembrado se les daño por lo duro del invierno, ellos perdieron todo y ahora con la ayuda de este crédito esperan volver a sembrar y recuperar en parte lo que se perdió.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar semillas, fertilizantes y además para pagar mano de obra para sembrar los cultivos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 4 ciclos  y le  gusta porque le ayudan con los créditos ya que si no fuera por este crédito no pudieran sembrar.
 
Sus sueños es poder recuperar lo que se perdió y salir adelante junto a su familia.
texts.en:
The members of the Mejorando El Futuro communal bank meet every two weeks in a place called Tierras Amarillas, within the Rocafuerte settlement.  This sector is known for its agriculture and most of its residents raise short cycle crops.


Editha lives here.  She’s 29 years old and is in a live in relationship and has an 11 year old daughter who attends school.  Her husband is a farmer.
 

Our friend works in partnership with one of her brothers.  They are farmers and tell us that they always plant rice, corn, and vegetables.  She is in charge of getting the loans with which they finance their crops, while her brother works the fields, along with two other people whom they pay.  Our friend tells us that they are just getting into the planting season and their previous crops were damaged by the harsh winter.  They lost everything and now, with the help of this loan, they hope to be able to replant and recover part of their losses. 
 

They will use the money from this loan to buy seed, fertilizer, and also pay for labor to plant the crops.  She has been part of the communal bank for four cycles and she likes it because it helps her with loans and they would not be able to plant without them.
 

Her hopes are to be able to recover her losses and come out ahead with her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies and pay for labor.

loans.name: Rasuljon

texts.ru: Расулчон трудолюбивый и добрый человек, он женат и на воспитании имеет четверых детей. Он мясник, и более 16 лет занимается продажей мясо. Имеет собственный ларёк на центральном рынке города. Расулчон хочет расширить свой бизнес, чтобы получить хорошую прибыль и содержать свою семью в хороших условиях. Расулчон запрашивает займ для покупки крупного и мелкого рогатого скота. Он надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Rasuljon is a hard-working and kind person. He is married and raising four children. He is a butcher, and has been selling meat for over 16 years. He has his own stand at the central market of his town. Rasuljon would like to expand his business in order to obtain good profits and provide a good quality of life for his family. Rasuljon is requesting a loan to buy cattle and sheep. He is hoping for your compassion and help.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Doña Teresa  es  una  persona  muy emprendedora   dedicada   a su negocio, que  es venta de cosméticos.  Vive con   sus  3  hijos.  En  Choluteca  en  el  sur de  Honduras.  Y  tiene  más  de 20   años  de  tener este tipo  de negocio.
Doña Teresa el  préstamo  lo invertirá en  la  compra  de  cosméticos  como  lociones, desinfectantes, talcos , desodorantes  ambientales  y  personales,  de esta manera  incrementara mas  sus ventas. Con el préstamo  al incrementar las ventas podra atender mejor  a sus  clientes, y  de  esta  manera  agenciarse  de  mejores  utilidades.  Doña Teresa espera  tener  mejores  ingresos  y  a si tener  mejor   forma  de  vida. Sus  sueños  es  poder  trabajar  en  su  casa  para  no  salir  a la  calle  a  vender  su  producto y darles  a sus  hijos  lo  mejor.
Choluteca  Honduras - Abril del 2012
texts.en:
Teresa  is a very enterprising woman who is dedicated to her business, which is selling cosmetics. She lives with her three children in Choluteca, in southern Honduras, and she has been in this type of business for over 20 years.
Teresa will invest the loan in purchasing cosmetics such as lotions, disinfectants, powders, air fresheners, and personal deodorants, so that she may further increase her sales. By increasing sales, the loan will allow her to better serve her customers so that she can obtain higher profits. 
Teresa hopes to earn a better income so that she can have a better life. Her dream is to work at home and not have to go out and sell her products on the street, as well as to give her children the very best.

Choluteca, Honduras - April, 2012

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, such as lotions, disinfectants, powders, air fresheners, and personal deodorants for her business.

loans.name: Bélgica Mirella

texts.es:
En una localidad llamada Tierras Amarillas del cantón Rocafuerte cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Mejorando El Futuro, este sector es conocido por su agricultura ya que gran parte de sus habitantes se dedican a los sembríos de ciclo corto.

En este lugar vive la señora Bélgica, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 11, 10 y 8 años de edad,  los tres  estudian en  colegio y escuela. El marido trabaja en un taller automotriz.
 
Nuestra amiga con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder ayudar a sus esposo con los gastos y salir adelante en el hogar, se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, aunque nos dice que la mayor parte de sus ventas son bajo pedido que le realizan sus clientes. Ella viaja hasta Guayaquil como mínimo una vez por mes a comprar lo que le encargan sus clientes y  también trae más mercadería para vender recorriendo la ciudad, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días.  Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende es ropa de mujer.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 5 años y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó este negocio ya que antes vendía productos Avon pero desistió de este negocio y prefirió vender ropa que le deja mejores ingresos.
 
Su sueño es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales,
texts.en:
The members of the Mejorando El Futuro communal bank meet every two weeks in a place called Tierras Amarillas, within the Rocafuerte settlement.  This sector is known for its agriculture and most of its residents raise short cycle crops.


Belgica lives here.  She is 31 years old and in a live in relationship and has three children, ages 11, 10, and 8.  They all attend school.  Her husband works in an automotive repair shop.


Our friend wanted to earn some income on her own so that she could help her husband with the expenses and help move her household ahead.  She sells clothing of all types by going door to door, but she tells us that most of her sales are orders from her customers.  She travels to Guayaquil at least once a month to buy what her customers order and also brings back other merchandise so that she can sell it around the city.  She sells on credit and collects every two weeks.  She has been doing this for two weeks and things are going well for her.  She sells mostly women’s clothing.
 

She will use the money from this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothing.  She has been a member of the communal bank for five years and she likes it because she started her business with one of the loans.  She used to sell Avon products, but she left this behind because she preferred to sell clothing because it brought in more income.


Her dream is to see her children complete their education and become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Migdonio

texts.es:
Migdonio actualmente desempeña el cargo de cajero  es un joven  con valores, deseos  de superación,   padre de un hijo a su cargo, los cuales quiere darles un futuro mejor con una vivienda digna y seguro.

Por esta razón,  se presentó a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para  compra de Cementó, Arena Y ladrillo, debido a que ha estado un poquito afectado con los fenómenos que han transcurrido en la zona, esto le permitirá obtener una mejor condición de vida con su familiar.
texts.en:
Migdonio is currently employed as a cashier. He is a young man with values and the drive to succeed. Migdonio is a father with a dependent child, so he wants to provide a better future and a decent, safe home.

This is why he has come to CEPRODEL and submitted a loan request. He will buy cement, sand, and bricks because he is a little bit concerned about the weather that has occurred in the area. This will enable him to have better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and bricks.

loans.name: Union Pour Vaincre La Pauvreté Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois Union Pour Vaincre la Pauvreté existe depuis le 9 avril 2011; le groupe PC01 est composé de vingt femmes qui sont en bonne entente,qui habitent le même village et mènent comme activités principales le petit commerce et l'embouche ovine, bovine et caprine entre autres.

Madame Diarra la présidente du Banc Villageois est âgée de 50 ans; elle est veuve sans enfant ( son mari a été assassiné par la rébellion armée)Elle mène une activité de commerce de produits agricoles arachide et "niébé" et a une bonne expérience.Sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillée en boubou blanc et a levé la main droite.

Elle s'approvisionne dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité et aux environs pour revendre dans la capitale et les grandes villes du pays.

Son prêt lui servira à acheter 100 kgs de "niébé" et d'arachide et espère se faire beaucoup plus de revenus.

Ses bénéfices lui servent à gérer ses charges mensuelles telles que payer la nourriture, les factures, aider ses neveux et nièces dans leur scolarité et renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
The “Union Pour Vaincre la Pauvreté” [Union for Combating Poverty] Banc Villageois exists since April 9, 2011. The PCO1 group is composed of 20 women who have a good rapport, live in the same village and mainly work as vendors and farmers raising sheep, goats and cattle.
Mrs. Diarra, the president of the Bnac Villageois, is 50 years old. She is a widow without children (her husband was killed in a military uprising). She grows peanuts and “niebe” [black-eyed peas] and has a lot of experience. On the photo she is standing on the right, dressed in a white outfit and raising her right hand.

She stocks up at the weekly market in her village and in the nearby region in order to resell in the capital and in the big cities of the country.
Her loan will allow her to buy 100 kg [220 lbs] of “niebe” and peanuts, and she hopes to earn higher revenues. Her income will allow her to cover her monthly expenses, such as food and utilities,  help her nephews and nieces with their educational expenses and bolster her savings.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products (black-eyed peas and peanuts) for resale.

loans.name: Omar De Jesús

texts.es:
Omar es una persona muy trabajadora y gracias a esta cualidad ha logrado sacar adelante a su esposa y sus 6 hijos brindándoles una buena calidad de vida y un buen estudio para progresar. Desde muy joven empezó a trabajar en diferentes restaurantes y tiendas, y gracias a esto adquirió la experiencia necesaria para decidir montar su propio negocio. Desde hace aproximadamente 6 meses montó una tienda general donde ofrece productos de la canasta familiar, y gracias a esto puede generar sus propios ingresos y su estabilidad económica ha mejorado indiscutiblemente. Debido a que sus ventas vienen en aumento, y ya que no cuenta con capital suficiente, busca que un préstamo le permita comprar productos de la canasta familiar para surtir su negocio y así ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.

Sus ingresos mejorarán considerablemente ya que podrá aumentar sus ventas, permitiendo tener unos mejores ingresos que le permitan brindar en su familia una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Omar is a hardworking individual. Because of this quality, he has been able to help his wife and six children move forward by providing them with a good quality of life and a good education so that they can progress.
