As a young man, Omar began working in different restaurants and stores. After acquiring the necessary experience, he decided to establish his own business. Approximately six months ago, Omar opened a general store where he offers basic household products. Thanks to his efforts, he has been able to generate his own income and his financial stability has improved immensely. Even though his sales are increasing, Omar does not have sufficient capital. Therefore, he is seeking a loan that will allow him to buy basic household products in order to restock his business and offer a wider variety of merchandise to his customers.

His earnings will improve considerably as his sales increase. This will enable him to have some more income and provide his family a better quality of life and better financial opportunities to make progress.

loans.use: to buy basic household products for restocking his store.

loans.name: Nelly Narcisa

texts.es:
En una localidad llamada Tierras Amarillas del cantón Rocafuerte cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Mejorando El Futuro, este sector es conocido por su agricultura ya que gran parte de sus habitantes se dedican a los sembríos de ciclo corto.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Nelly, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 8 hijos, 6 de ellos ya  mayores de edad y dos de 15 y 13 años de edad, con ellos viven 4 de sus hijos, uno de los mayores estudia en universidad y los menores en colegio. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Nuestra amiga trabaja en sociedad con uno de sus hijos, ellos se dedican a la venta de leche y quesos, nos cuenta que su hijo se desplaza por los campos en su carro y así recogen la leche que sacan todas las mañanas ciertos ganaderos para luego llevarla hasta su casa en la cual dedican una parte a elaborar los deliciosos quesos y la otra parte la lleva a vender por localidades vecinas junto con el queso que el dia anterior fabricaron, ellos trabajan todos los días en las mañanas y llevan más de 10 años realizando esta labor que si les deja buenos ingresos.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar leche. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio, es la tesorera del grupo y le  gusta porque sus compañeras son muy unidas y responsables.
 
Sus sueños es seguir adelante y que sus hijos menores terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
The members of the Mejorando El Futuro communal bank meet every two weeks in a place called Tierras Amarillas, within the Rocafuerte settlement.  This sector is known for its agriculture and most of its residents raise short cycle crops.


Here we meet Nelly.  She is 49 years old, married, and has eight children from this relationship.  Six of them are adults and two are ages 15 and 13.  Four of their children live with them.  The oldest studies at university and the others attend school.  Her husband it a farmer.

 
Our friend works in partnership with one of her sons.  They sell milk and cheese.  She says that her son drives to farms in his car and picks up the milk that certain farmers produce, takes it home, and uses part of it to make delicious cheeses.  They sell the rest to neighboring communities, along with the cheese that they made the day before.  They work every morning and they have been doing this for 10 years.  It provides a good income.


She will use the money from this loan to buy milk.  She has been in the communal bank since it began.  She’s the treasurer and she likes her fellow members because they are very united and responsible.


Her dreams are to continue forward and for her youngest children to complete their educations.

loans.use: to buy milk.

loans.name: Agustina Monserrate

texts.es:
En una localidad llamada Tierras Amarillas del cantón Rocafuerte cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Mejorando El Futuro, este sector es conocido por su agricultura ya que gran parte de sus habitantes se dedican a los sembríos de ciclo corto.

En este lugar vive la señora Agustina. Tiene  58 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es comerciante.

Nuestra amiga  es una gran ama de casa que realiza el crédito para ayudar a su esposo el mismo que tiene un negocio de venta de mariscos, nos cuenta que esta es su forma de colaborar con él  para el bienestar de su familia, él se desplaza todos los días hasta el mercado de Portoviejo para comprar los mejores  mariscos para sus clientes, lleva de todo un poco como camarón, calamar, pescado por libras para que sus clientes puedan elegir que comprar y así queden contentos con lo que él ofrece. Nos cuenta que luego se surtirse de sus mariscos en el mercado de mayoristas sale a vender  en su triciclo por toda la ciudad.

Este crédito es para comprar calamares, camarón, pescado, entre otros mariscos. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque le han ayudado mucho con los créditos tanto a ella como a sus amigas del banco.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa bien arreglada ya que la que tiene esta muy viejita.
texts.en:
The members of the Mejorando El Futuro communal bank meet every two weeks in a place called Tierras Amarillas, within the Rocafuerte settlement.  This sector is known for its agriculture and most of its residents raise short cycle crops.


Here we meet Agustina.  She is 58 years old, married, and has three adult children, all on their own.  Her husband is a merchant.


Our friend is a wonderful housewife who is asking for this loan in order to help her husband who has a seafood business.  She tells us that this is her way of cooperating with him for the wellbeing of the family.  He travels every day to the market in Portoviejo to buy the best seafood for his customers.  He takes a little of everything; shrimp, calamari, fish by the pound, so that his customers can select what to buy and be happy with what he offers.  He says that after he stocks up in the wholesale market, he goes out in his tricycle to sell around the city.


This loan is so that he can buy calamari, shrimp, and fish among other seafood.  She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because it has helped greatly with the loans; both her and her friends from the bank.


Her dream is to have a fixed up home now that the current one is so old.

loans.use: to buy seafood.

loans.name: Adriana Querida

texts.es:
En una localidad llamada Tierras Amarillas del cantón Rocafuerte cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Mejorando El Futuro, este sector es conocido por su agricultura ya que gran parte de sus habitantes se dedican a los sembríos de ciclo corto.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Adriana, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa y la menor estudia en universidad. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Nuestra amiga para salir adelante y ganar algo por el bienestar de sus familia hace más de cinco años y con la ayuda de su esposo construyeron una cabaña, allí todas las tardes venden corviches, empanadas, totillas de yuca y de maíz, además de aguas, colas y jugos, los fines de semana también prepara deliciosos platos típicos como los  deliciosos secos y caldo de gallina criolla, así como también el caldo de mondongo con verduras, platos que son muy solicitados por sus clientes, en  estos días le ayudan su hija y su esposo.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar maíz, yuca, maní, gallinas y otros ingredientes para preparar los deliciosos platos. Está en el Banco Comunal casi desde el inicio  y le  gusta por la ayudan que le brindan con los créditos.

 Su sueño es ver que su hija sea una muy buena profesional.
texts.en:
The members of the Mejorando El Futuro communal bank meet every two weeks in a place called Tierras Amarillas, within the Rocafuerte settlement.  This sector is known for its agriculture and most of its residents raise short cycle crops.


Here we meet Adriana.  She is 56 years old, married, and has four adult children.  Two of them still live at home and the youngest studies at university.  Her husband is a farmer.
 

Our friend, in order to get ahead and earn something for her family’s wellbeing, built a canana with her husband’s help more than five years ago.  There they sell corviches, empanadas, yucca and corn tortillas, and also water, colas, and juices.  On the weekends she also prepares delicious typical dishes such as entrees and creole chicken soup and tripe soup with vegetables.  These dishes are requested by her customers.  Her daughter and her husband help her on these days.
 

She will use the money from this loan to buy corn, yucca, peanuts, and chicken among other ingredients to prepare her delicious dishes.  She has been with the communal bank almost since the start and she likes it because of the loans.


Her dream is for her daughter to become a good professional.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Jose Martin

texts.es:
José tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Mórrope, lugar caracterizado por encontrarse conformado por un pueblo central en donde se concentra todo el comercio y por varios caseríos aledaños en donde vive gente humilde y muy trabajadora, la zona pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a más de hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Al igual que la mayoría de pobladores de la zona, se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales para ayudarse a percibir ingresos, ella cría animales menores tales como pavos, patos, pollos, etc. tambien cria y comercia ganado porcino, caprino y ovino en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando estas ya ha alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan el lugar en donde vive.
José desea mejorar la alimentación de los animales que cría para percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar  a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

José es bastante conocido en la zona, sus vecinos le consideran honrado y confiable.
texts.en:
José, 35, has a live-in partner and lives with his family in the Mórrope district, a place made up of a central town where all the businesses are located and several neighboring hamlets inhabited by modest and very hardworking people.  The area is in the province of Lambayeque and is located more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

Like the majority of the residents of the area, he works raising and selling animals to help himself earn an income.  He raises small animals such as turkeys, ducks, chickens, etc.  He also raises and sells pigs, goats, and sheep behind his house.  When they have reached a good size he offers them for sale to the merchants who always visit the place where he lives.

José wants to improve the nourishment of the animals he raises to get greater income, so he found it advisable to request a loan for 3000 nuevos soles [PEN] from Edpyme Alternativa to help realize his goal.

José is very well known in the area; his neighbors consider him to be honorable and trustworthy.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for his animals.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a mother of five children who are aged between 19 and 30 years. She has been in active farming in her home area of Kitale in Western Kenya for 10 successive years, doing mainly milk and maize farming. She reiterates that farming has been her sole source of income for the last 10 years and has helped her in educating her children.

Annah has requested a second loan of 82,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow at 52,000 KES, as well as to construct a modern dairy unit at 30,000 KES. She says the loan will help improve her farming income to pay for her last-born child to go to college and provide enough milk for the family.

Annah says Juhudi Kilimo's services have been of great help to farmers. She is focusing on the timely repayment of this, her second loan with Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow and construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Nissan Group

texts.en:
Nasra, who is in her early 30s, is single with two children who go to school.  She has been running two businesses as a food vendor and selling rice for 10 years now.  She works from 6.00 am to 6.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Nasra's ninth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  With the previous loans, she restocked the missing items in the food store; paid school fees and household expenses; and started selling rice, which she collects from upcountry. She has paid back all her loans successfully.  

Nasra wants a loan to increase food stock to sell to more people and to make more trips upcountry and buy more rice. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

Nasra will share this loan with her loan group "Nissan," which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase food stock to sell to more people and to make more trips upcountry and buy more rice.

loans.name: Luz Y Prosperidad Group

texts.es: La Sra. Elsa de 37 años de edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solo uno depende de ella. Tiene 5 años como cliente de Edaprospo y se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos desde hace 5 años. Comenzó con la idea de poder dar una buena educación a sus hijos. También se dedica al servicio de limpieza a domicilio desde hace 2 años. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado dar apoyo de educación a su hija menor y ha podido ampliar su negocio. Actualmente su ingreso lo destina a cubrir los gastos por servicios público como agua y luz, mientras que su esposo cubre los gastos de alimentación. Su plan para el futuro es terminar de construir su casa. Ella usó el crédito en la compra de mercadería para su negocio. Elsa pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Luz y Prosperidad” el cual esta conformado por 10 personas y lleva el cargo de presidenta desde hace 4 meses.
texts.en:
Elsa, 37, is married and has 5 children, only one of whom is still a dependent. She has been a client of Edaprospo for 5 years and during that time has worked selling clothing and cosmetics. She started with the idea of being able to give her kids a good education. She also has been cleaning houses for two years. With her hard work she has been able to support the education of her youngest daughter and to increase the size of her business. Currently her income helps to cover the cost of utilities like water and electricity, while her husband covers food expenses. Her plan for the future is to finish building her house. 

She used the loan to buy merchandise for her store. She belongs to the village bank "Luz y Prosperidad" which is made up of 10 people; she has been president for 4 months.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Choestancia Group

texts.es:
La señora Florinda esta casada, tiene 31 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos 2  de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la crianza de animales, inicio este negocio con capital pequeño y hasta el momento lleva 8 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara, para la compra de pollo de engorde, y así tener una buenas ganancias cuando estos animales hallan crecido,  espera en el futuro tener un negocio superado y con mejores ganancias. Los demás integrantes se dedican a la artesanía, comercio y a la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Florinda is married, 31 years old, and finished 3 years of primary education. She has three children of whom two are studying. She makes a living raising of animals. She started this business with small capital and so far it has been 8 years. She has the support of her husband who makes a living in commerce. 

She organized a group to apply for a loan, which she will use for the purchase of chicken for fattening, and thus have a good profits when these animals are grown. She hopes to have a good business and better profits. The other members make a living doing crafts, trade and animal breeding.

loans.use: to buy animals for breeding

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es: La señora Wilma tiene 35 años nacida en Sanandita, Tarija es casada con el señor Félix con el cual tienen 3 hijos,  de las edades de 14, 10 y 6 años,  ellos viven en el km. 14 doble vía a la guardia, la señora Wilma se dedica a la venta de ropa de temporada  entre semana y también a la venta de vajillas y utensilios de cocina a crédito y según pedidos que le hagan, el crédito que solicita lo va a invertir en la compra de vajillas y utensilios de cocina ya que tiene varios pedidos que entregar,  ella esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del préstamo y su deseo es el de ver a sus hijos profesionales y personas de bien.
texts.en:
Wilma, 35, was born in Sanandita, Tarija. She is married to Felix with whom she has 3 children ages 14, 10 and 6. They live at kilometer 14 by the police station. Wilma sells seasonal clothing during the week and also sells dishes and cooking utensils on credit by special order. 

She asks for a loan to invest in the purchase of dishes and utensils because she has several orders to deliver. She is grateful to the institution for the support they have given her with this loan. Her wish is to see her children become professionals and be well-off.

loans.use: to buy dishes and cooking utensils.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: El señor Cesar tiene 33 años oriundo de puerto rico - el Torno, casado y tienen dos hijos de las edades de 8 y 10 años que se encuentran en edad escolar, su domicilio es alquilado se encuentra ubicado en la zona San Andrés, es de ocupación carpintero, trabaja en su propio taller ubicado en el mismo barrio en el domicilio de su padre ya hace unos cinco años se dedica a esta labor, el destino del crédito es para la compra de madera al por mayor, con el anterior credito le fue muy bien ya que hizo refaccionar su taller, se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que se le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Cesar, 33, is originally from El Torno, Puerto Rico. He is married and has two children ages 8 and 10 who are in school. He rents a home in the San Andres neighborhood and works as a carpenter. He has had his own workshop in his parents' neighborhood since he decided to begin this work 5 years ago. 

The loan will be used to buy lumber in bulk. His previous loan went well because he was able to make repairs to his workshop. He is grateful to the institution for the support that they have given him.

loans.use: to buy lumber in bulk.

loans.name: Kheng's Group

texts.en:
Kheng is 30 years old and married. She still has three children to take care of and they are still in school and also work at the family’s business. Her family’s source of income is from rice farming and a cassava plantation in which she has been working for several years. The main challenge for her is the lack of working capital to support her business. With her current business, she is able to earn around 16,400 KHR per day. 

Kheng has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles while the other member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. With her previous two loans, Kheng has managed to put away some savings for her family. Now requesting a new loan with VisionFund, Kheng, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pay for labor. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income so as to build on her savings and start up another business for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labor

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto, 42, is a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. He is single and works hard to support himself and cover his everyday expenses.

Roberto operates a food stall and sells fish balls. In the Philippines, fish balls are commonly sold on street sidewalks. They are served skewered and can be dipped with different kinds of sauces. Fish balls are somewhat flat in shape and often made with the meat of a cuttlefish. His other products include squid balls and quail eggs. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of Php 200 in sales every day.

To help him continue operating his business, he is requesting a Php 11,000 loan. He will use the loan to buy more quantities of fish ball products and other ingredients needed in his business. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.

Roberto hopes to be able to expand soon. He faithfully meets with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work week and also draws strength and inspiration studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of fish ball products and other ingredients needed in his business.

loans.name: Ani Safaryan

texts.en: Ani, 25, lives in Kapan town with her husband. Ani is a lecturer at the local medical college and her husband works at a local factory. For two years the couple has been involved in agriculture keeping a greenhouse and breeding poultry. Ani has applied for this loan to develop the farm. She wants to renovate the greenhouse and create more favorable conditions for vegetables to grow. She also wants to purchase poultry. These changes are important for Ani and her husband to earn more income and ensure better conditions for their children in the future.

loans.use: to pay for poultry and a greenhouse renovation.

loans.name: Juntas Pr Group

texts.es: La Sra. Guisela de 27 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 1 hijo el cual aún depende de ella. Tiene 3 años como cliente de Edaprospo y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace 4 años. Actualmente ocupa el cargo de directora en la empresa “UNIQUE”, y tiene su propio negocio que lleva el nombre de “LEGUISAN EIRL”. Guisela comenzó con la venta de cosméticos por catálogos, pero con su esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado abrir su propia empresa. Actualmente su ingreso lo destina a cubrir todos los gastos que tiene como alimentación y pago de servicios público. Su plan para el futuro es terminar de construir su casa. Ella usó el crédito en la compra de productos de belleza para su empresa. Guisela pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Juntas Progresaremos”, el cual esta conformado por 9 personas y lleva el cargo de presidenta desde que se conformó el grupo.
texts.en:
Guisela, 27, is single and has one dependent son. She has been a client of Esaprospo for 3 years and has been selling cosmetics for 4 years. Currently she is the director of the business "UNIQUE" and has her own business called "LEGUISAN EIRL". Guisela started selling cosmetics from catalogs, but through hard work she has been able to open her own business. Currently her income covers costs like food and utilities. Her plan for the future is to finish building her house.

She will use this loan to buy beauty products for her business. Guisela belongs to the village bank "Juntas Progresaremos" [Together We Make Progress], which is made up of 9 people; she has been the president since the group formed.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Los Luchadores Del Sector C Group

texts.es:
“LOS LUCHADORES DEL SECTOR C”  es una alcancía  recién formada,  son 06  vecinas  del mismo lugar todas con diferentes negocios, una de ellas es la Sra.  Bethzabet  que se dedica a la venta de ropa a crédito ya tiene cerca de un año en el negocio y le va muy bien,  sus clientes son vecinos y personas que viven alrededor de su zona. Ella  recorre diferentes lugares  ofreciendo varias  prendas como pantalones, polos, camisas etc. por otro lado también se ayuda con la venta de algunos dulces como empanadas y pasteles. Gracias a su trabajo puede mantener a sus 2 hijos, siendo madre soltera tiene muchas obligaciones que con su trabajo puede suplir, en el futuro le gustaría tener una empresa en el rubro de ventas  por ahora quiere seguir trabajando y ahorrando, este es su primer préstamo y lo utilizara para la compra de  ropa de invierno ,debido a la cercanía del invierno será muy provechoso para ella.
*Bethzabet es la 2da de las paradas (derecha).
texts.en:
Los Luchadores del Sector C is a recenty-formed group made up of 6 neighbors with different businesses. One of them is Bethzabet, who sells clothing on credit. She has been doing this for about a year and it's going very well. Her customers are neighbors and people who live nearby. She goes around to different places offering various garments like pants, polo shirts, blouses, etc. She also helps to sell some sweets like empanadas and cakes. Thanks to her work she is able to take care of her two children. As a single mother, she has a lot of obligations that her work helps her to meet. In the future she would like to have a business in sales. For now, she hopes to keep working and saving.

This is her first loan and she will use it to buy winter clothing, because winter is approaching and it will be very profitable for her.

*Bethzabet is second from the right, standing.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing.

loans.name: Uniendo Fuerzas Group

texts.es: María de 64 años, es  viuda con 10 hijos independientes. Hace más de 03 años que  se dedica a la venta de anticuchos y mazamorras la cual lo realiza ambulatoriamente. Aparte brinda servicios de limpieza obteniendo un ingreso extra para su hogar.  María se siente orgullosa  pues con su trabajo y esfuerzo a logrado cumplir algunas de sus metas como construir  parte de su vivienda y brindarle educación a su hijos.  Terminar de construir su casa  es su siguiente meta. Su último préstamo lo destinara para  la compra de insumos como aceite, carnes, limones, etc. y medicamentos para ella, ya que se está recuperando de una operación.  María pertenece a la Alcancía Comunal “Uniendo fuerzas” la cual está conformado por 08 socios responsables y trabajadores. Ellos agradecen el crédito brindado. María está ubicada al lado izquierdo y viste chompa blanca y falda color negro.  En la parte superior esta   Yemima y Mari.
texts.en:
Maria is 64 years old, is a widow with 10 independent children. For more than three years she has made a living selling kebab and maize porridge which sales on the streets. In addition to this, she also offer cleaning services, which gives her an extra income for her home. 

Maria is proud because it is due to effort and hard work that she has managed to achieve some of her goals like built part of her home and provided education to her children. 

Finishing her house is her next goal. With this last loan she intends to purchase supplies such as oil, meat, lemons, etc. , and medicines for her, because she is recovering from an operation. Mary belongs to the communal bank Joining Forces which has eight responsible and hard working members. They appreciate the support provided. (In the picture) Maria is located on the left side, wearing a white sweater and black skirt. At the top is Yemima and Mari.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and medicines.

loans.name: Evelin

texts.es: La Señorita Evelin  tiene 21 años y es soltera, ella se dedica a la confección de prendas de  vestir tiene su taller de costura en la zona de Villa Fátima,  este préstamo es el sexta secuencia dentro de la institución, la Srta. Evelin  va a usar este préstamo  para capital de trabajo (compra de maquina over y recta) para su negocio, la razón para solicitar este préstamo es hacer crecer el negocio, la Srta.  Evelin enfrenta retos en su negocio que son  la competencia del mercado y la falta de maquinaria para la confección de prendas de vestir y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando las maquinas que le hacen falta y así de esta manera  incrementar su capital de trabajo, su deseo para su  negocio es tener un taller de costura más grande contratar personal que le ayude a confeccionar sus prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Evelin is 21 years old and single. She makes a living making dresses. She has her sewing workshop in the area of Villa Fatima. 

This loan is her sixth loan within the field partner. Evelin will use this loan for working capital and for the purchase of a machine for her business. The reason for requesting this loan is to grow the business.

Ms. Evelin faces challenges in her business such as competition and lack of equipment. She is going to use the profits to continue to buy machines that she needs and thus increase her capital, her wish is to have a larger sewing shop largest and to hire staff to help her make the dresses.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Gloria Liliam

texts.es:
Gloria Liliam Actualmente cuenta con su propia vivienda, desempeña el cargo de Responsable de caja chica, es una joven con espíritu de superación en la vida cuenta con dos hijo a  su cargo, donde tiene 16 años de vivir en esta localidad, se presentó a Ceprodel con el Fin de mejorar su vivienda.

Por esta razón,   solicita un crédito para la compra de  Cemento y Arena y así poder vivir en mejores condiciones de vida con su familia, de igual manera Ceprodel apoya a este tipo de persona, por lo cual agradece de ante mano que le puedan brindar este apoyo ya que ha tenido tres créditos con esta institución y han sido provechosos para su desarrollo familiar.
texts.en:
Gloria Liliam currently has a home of her own and is employed as a cashier. This young woman possesses a spirit for excellence in her life. She has two dependent children and has lived in this town for 16 years. Gloria came to CEPRODEL in order to improve her home.

She is requesting a loan to buy cement and sand. This will help improve her family's living conditions. CEPRODEL supports people like Gloria who are grateful to receive a helping hand. She has already taken advantage of the assistance from three previous CEPRODEL loans so that her family can develop.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand.

loans.name: Emmanuel Plus Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel Plus is a Community Bank of 19 owners of small businesses who selected Erick as chairman. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva through the MFI HOPE DRCongo to grow their businesses. They organized themselves by affinity and proximity.
Erick earns a living by selling loaves of bread and fresh foods in his neighborhood located northeast of Kinshasa. He has many customers. He started his business in 1986. His business brings in a profit of about US$100 each week.  Erick is planning with the next loan to increase the stock of his business by buying more loaves of bread to resell at profit. His ambition is to provide loaves of bread to more than a thousand customers in medium term. He is 52 years old, married and the father of five children between the ages of 15 and 20. Three of them go to school.

loans.use: to increase his stock by buying more loaves of bread to resell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Cindy Tatiana

texts.es: Cindy tiene 21 años de edad y es madre soltera. Vive en Milagros en una casa que alquila. Se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos. Cindy nos comenta que su familia se a dedicado al comercio toda la vida y que desde muy pequeña le han enseñado. La actividad que desarrolla le gusta mucho por que le permite dedicarse a otras actividades sobre todo su familia. El trabajo lo realiza sola pero con la comida  le ayuda una señora que contrata de manera temporal de 7 a 11 de la mañana. Su horario es muy activo empezando de 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. la crianza de pollos es un poco delicado ya que se necesita de cuidado en la alimentación y salud, el clima a veces no ayuda por ese motivo la época de invierno es muy dura. Tiene 1 niño de 4 años, no asiste a la escuela por lo que ella lo cuida. El préstamo lo empleara comprando pollos, balanceado, vitaminas. Su sueño es poder comprar un vehículo en el cual transportase para entregar por mayor y así poder darle u buen futuro a su hijo.
texts.en:
21-year-old Cindy is a single mother, and lives in a rented house is Milagros. She has a business selling and raising chickens. Cindy tells us that her family has devoted their lives to trade and she learnt this from a young age. She likes her job because it allows her to pursue other interests, especially her family. Cindy works alone, but she has hired a lady to help with feeding between 7 to 11 am.

Cindy's schedule is very active, starting from 7 am until 6 pm. Raising chickens is a rather delicate because they need both food and healthcare, and the climate sometimes poses a difficulty as the winter season is very hard. Cindy has one child aged 4, who does not go to school and is in Cindy's care. 

This loan will be invested in buying chickens, balanced feed and vitamins. Cindy's dream is to buy a vehicle which she can use for wholesale purchases, so that she can provide a better future for her child.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, balanced feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Edizon Melbin

texts.es: Desde Quevedo conocimos a Edizon quien vende comidas rápidas. Su local lo ubica en una gasolinera donde labora de lunes a domingos en las tardes y noches. Empezó con un pequeño capital que había reunido de diversos trabajos realizados, gracias a esto compro una carreta donde cocina sus productos para la venta. La atención la realiza solo en horarios de viernes a domingos y vende salchipapas, papi pollo, hot dog, hamburguesas, colas. Tiene un sector determinado lo cual le permite mantener  la clientela de la que goza. A sus 35 años está casado con Amada quien es ama de casa, también le ayuda en la venta sus fines de semana. Tienen un niño que estudia en la escuela fiscal. Con dinero del préstamo comprara pollo, papa y aceite para la venta esperando que aumente para terminar de arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
Edizon,35, is a fast food seller from Quevedo. He has set up his stall at a gas station where he works from Monday to Sunday in the afternoon and evening. He started his business with a small capital investment that he had saved from previous jobs, and thanks to this he was able to buy a cart from which he prepares his dishes to sell. 

He attends his stall himself, from Friday to Sunday and sells salchipapas (sausages and potatoes), chicken, hot dogs, burgers and colas. He has an established sector which allows him to maintain his clientele. Edizon is married to Amada who is a housewife and also helps him to sell his products at the weekends. They have one child who attends public school. With money from the loan Edizon will buy chicken, potatoes and oil to sell. He is hoping to increase his income so that he can finish fixing his home.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, potatoes and oil.

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es: Olinda vive en el sector conocido como Suburbio. Tiene en su domicilio un local en el cual vende ropa, alhajas y zapatos desde hace 30 años ya que siempre ha sido comerciante. A sus 60 años se mantiene activa porque le gusta tener sus propios ingresos. Su mayor dificultad son los ladrones que rondan el sector ya que al estar sola en su negocio se vuelve vulnerable a los asaltos. En la actualidad Olinda se encuentra sola, no llego a casarse pero si tuvo hijos los cuales son mayores de edad e independientes. Se siente satisfecha con su trabajo ya que gracias a esto pudo darle educación, salud y bienestar a su familia a pesar de encontrarse sola. El préstamo le ayudara a aumentar la capital de trabajo con la compra de zapatos, ropa  con lo que espera tener mayores ingresos y seguir adelante con el negocio.
texts.en:
Olinda lives in the section of town known as Suburbio. She has a home-based store where she has been selling clothing, jewelry, and shoes for 30 years. Olinda has always been a merchant. At 60 years of age, she remains active because she like having her own income. Her greatest difficulty is dealing with robbers who roam the neighborhood. Since she is alone in her business, Olinda is vulnerable to attacks.

She is by herself at the moment. Olinda never got married, but she has children who are now grown and independent. She enjoys her work and has been able to provide her family with an education, good health, and overall well-being even though she is alone. The loan will help increase her operating capital for buying shoes and clothing. She hopes to have more income and to continue moving forward with her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush is 43. She lives in Kapan town with her husband, two sons and a daughter. Anush's husband and one son work at the local factories. Three years ago Anush started her own business of making and selling food. Now she wants to make more types of food, for which she needs special equipment. Anush, together with her family, also wants to start a new business of fruit and vegetable sales. She plans to invest a part of the requested loan to create the necessary conditions and purchase fruits and vegetables. 

Development of both businesses is important for Anush to earn more income, cover her family's costs and save for her children's education.

loans.use: to pay for equipment for making food, and buying fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Lider De Defensores Group

texts.es:
La Sra. María se dedica hace varios años al tejido artesanal, labor que desempeña con mucho ánimo porque se siente bien cuando crea nuevos modelos, cuando empezó con el tejido lo hacía solo por afición; poco a poco fue perfeccionando buscando cursos y capacitándose para realizar  mejores trabajos, así logro que sus creaciones sean de buena calidad. La Sra. Maria  animada por sus amigas empezó  a ofrecer sus productos especialmente ropas de hilo en su mayoría polos, vestidos y chompas para niños. Este negocio le ha dado muchas satisfacciones entre ellas poder comprarse algunos muebles para su casa y cubrir algunos gastos de la familia, para mas adelante le gustaría contar con un lugar mas amplio para convertirlo en taller y vender directamente al publico, actualmente ella es parte de la alcancía “LIDER DE DEFENSORES” su préstamo lo usara para la compra de lanas, hilos y otros materiales que necesita para sus tejidos.

*La Sra. Maria es la 5ta de las paradas esta con lentes
texts.en:
For several years, María has been creating artisanal garments. She enjoys her work because it feels good when she creates new designs. When she fist started it was just a hobby, and she gradually improved by taking courses and training herself in order to find better jobs and ensure that her creations are of good quality. After being encouraged by her friends, María started to offer her products for sale, particularly clothes, most of which are shirts, dresses and sweaters for children. 

Her business has given her great satisfaction and among other things she was able to buy some furniture for her home and cover some of her family expenses. In future she would like to have a larger place that she can convert into a workshop to make her products and sell directly to the public. María is part of the communal bank “LIDER DE DEFENSORES” and she will use the loan to purchase wool, yarn and other materials needed for her creations. 

María is the 5th lady from the right, wearing glasses.

loans.use: to purchase wool, yarn and other materials needed for her creations.

loans.name: Syuzanna

texts.en: Syuzanna is 31. She lives with her husband and two sons. The main source of income for the family is beekeeping, in which Syuzanna and her husband have been involved for 5 years. Now Syuzanna would like to increase the number of beehives, which will allow her to gather more honey. Demand for this product is increasing in the town and the whole region, so Syuzanna will increase the sales of honey and get additional income, which is important for her to meet the family's goals.

loans.use: to pay for beehives

loans.name: Alisa

texts.en:
Alisa is 25. She lives with her husband and little daughter. Alisa's husband works at one of the local factories. However, his salary is too low to meet the needs. So the couple also runs a farm, where they raise cattle. The main income comes from making cheese and selling in Kapan town, the regional center. Due to the high quality of the cheese, Alisa has gained many loyal clients among the citizens. 

Alisa would like to increase the number of cattle, which will allow her to gather more milk and make more cheese. With the requested loan Alisa plans to purchase a cow and 2 heifers.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and 2 heifers

loans.name: Viktorya

texts.en: Viktorya is 26. She lives in Dovrus community and is happily married with one child. Two years ago this young and cheerful lady, with her husband's support, established a hair dressing salon. Due to the quality of services, Viktorya has gained a large number of loyal clients. She wants to improve the services in her salon, for which she has applied for this loan. Viktorya plans to purchase new hair dressing equipment and furniture for the salon. This will allow Viktorya to attract new clients and develop her business further by adding new services.

loans.use: to pay for hair dressing equipment and furniture

loans.name: Eugenia Marisol

texts.es: Eugenia tiene 45 años y vive en Paraíso de la Flor sector periurbano de Guayaquil. Su historia como comerciante empezó al momento en que se separo de esposo, al no tener ingresos decidió empezar a vender productos de belleza por catálogos ya que de esa manera podía cuidar a sus hijos. Luego de esto decidió variar sus productos empezando la venta de disco y cuadernos. No tiene un local por lo que realiza el comercio en la sala de su domicilio. Eugenia nos comenta que le gusta buscar la manera de obtener dinero por lo que también vende almuerzos. En la entrevista nos dimos cuenta que Eugenia al ser cabeza de familia busca la manera de ser productiva y generar dinero. Tiene 3 hijos quienes estudian en el colegio fiscal y le ayudan en la atención en sus ratos libres. El préstamo lo utilizara para la compra de productos como cremas, perfumes, maquillaje, ropa para su venta y espera que mejoren para poder cancelar sus cuotas sin problemas.
texts.en:
Eugenia is 45 years old and lives in Paraíso de la Flor, a suburban area of Guayaquil. Her life as a trader began when she separated from husband - she had no income and decided to start selling beauty products by catalog so that she could care for their children. After that, she decided to add some variety to her products and started to sell CDs and notebooks. She trades from the living room in her home. 

Eugenia says that she likes finding ways to make money, and so she also sells lunch. In the interview, Eugenia told us that as  the head of the family and is always looking for ways to be productive and make money. She has 3 children who study at the public school, and they also help her with the business in their free time. 

This loan will be used to purchase products such as creams, perfumes, makeup, and clothes to sell. Eugenia hopes to improve her business and pay her installments without any problems.

loans.use: to purchase creams, perfumes, makeup, and clothes.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en: Gagik lives in Meghri with his wife and little son. Gagik works at the local canned food factory, but his salary is too low to cover the family's costs. So Gagik is also involved in agriculture. He raises cattle, and now his farm consists of 2 cows and 4 pigs. Gagik also keeps 5 beehives. He has applied for this loan to develop cattle breeding. With the requested amount he plans to purchase 3 cows. This will allow Gagik to increase the income from agriculture and ensure a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for 3 cows

loans.name: Styopa

texts.en:
Styopa lives in Vostan village with his father, younger brother and grandmother. Styopa is involved in agriculture together with his family members. He is very enthusiastic and full of desire to develop the family farm, for which he needs necessary funds. He has applied for this loan to purchase 2 pigs. Styopa will also purchase tomato seeds, fertilizer and medicine. 

Styopa dreams of funding a big farm, where he will have conditions to grow different types of fruits and vegetables. Current development of the farm will provide a good base for Styopa  to reach his goal.

loans.use: to pay for 2 pigs, tomato seeds, fertilizer and medicine

loans.name: Hortense Afiavi

texts.fr: Hortense Afiavi est mariée et mère d'1 enfant scolarisé âgé de 09 ans. Elle a encore un enfant à charge. Hortense Afiavi est coiffeuse de formation et y associe la vente des mèches,des tissages ainsi que des produits depuis 14 ans. Hortense Afiavi s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés de l'extérieur et ses clients sont essentiellement des femmes et ses collègues coiffeuses. Elle veut s'acheter des mèches, des tissages et des produits. Hortense Afiavi avec ses économies veut contribuer activement à la charge familiale.
texts.en:
Hortense Afiavi is married and the mother of a 9 year old child, who attends school. She has one other child living in the household. Hortense Afiavi is a hairdresser by training, and has also sold hair extensions, weaves and hair products for the last 14 years.
Hortense Afiavi buys her stock in one of the outlying markets, and her customers are mostly women and other hairdressers.
She wants to purchase extensions, weaves and hair products. With her savings, Hortense Afiavi wants to actively contribute to the household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 30 hair extensions, 30 weaves and other various products.

loans.name: Joemar

texts.en:
This is Joemar, 42, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. He is single and works hard to sustain himself and continually provide income for his everyday expenses.

Joemar operates a food stall where he sells fish balls. In the Philippines, fish balls are commonly sold at street stalls; they are served skewered and can be dipped in different kinds of sauces. Fish balls are somewhat flat in shape and often made with the meat of a cuttlefish. His other products include squid balls and quail eggs. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 200 Philippines pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue his business operations, he is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan. He will use the loan to buy more fish ball products and other ingredients needed in his business. He expects a boost to his income as he expands his business.

Joemar hopes to be able to expand his business soon. He faithfully meets up with his fellowship* co-members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of fish ball products needed for his business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 46 years old and married with one child.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and other groceries to sell in her store.

Josephine has borrowed and paid for six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for three years.  Josephine aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Lidia Maria

texts.es: Lidia nació en Pueblo Viejo pero actualmente vive en Quevedo. Tiene 62 años y se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos. Nos cuenta que en Pueblo Viejo vivía en una finca donde se criaban animales y desde muy pequeña le enseñaron para que ayudara. Al casarse su esposo la llevo a vivir a la cuidad de Quevedo donde era ama de casa dedicándose al cuidado de sus hijos. Hace 8 años empezó el oficio porque se separo de su esposo y necesitaba solventar sus gastos. Le gusta su trabajo porque le da tiempo a cuidar de su salud y descansar. La alimentación y limpieza de los animales la realiza con su nuera quien le ayuda en los momentos que no se encuentran. Su mayor preocupación es que sus animales se le enfermen ya perdería capital, ganancia y el esfuerzo de criarlos. Sus hijos son todos mayores de edad tienen su propia familia, la visitan de vez en cuando. Con el crédito comprar maíz, vitaminas para el engorde de los pollos y algunos materiales para arreglar su casa ya que le gustaría terminar su construcción.
texts.en:
Linda was born in Pueblo Viejo but now lives in Quevedo.  She is 62 years old and she raises and sells chicken.  She tells us that in Pueblo Viejo she lived on a farm where they raised animals, and when she was a child she was taught how work with them.

When she married her husband she came to Quevedo and spent her time raising their children and taking care of the household.  8 years ago she began working because she separated from her husband and she needed to pay her expenses.

She likes her work because it gives her time to care for her health and to rest.  She feeds and cleans the animals with her daughter, who always helps her when she needs help.  Her biggest worry is that her animals will get sick and she will lose her income, money, and the ability to care for them.  Her children are all adults and have their own families and she visits them from time to time.

With this loan she will buy corn, vitamins to fatten the chicken, and other supplies so that she can fix up her house (she would like to finish construction on her house).

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her chicken.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Calixta Cirila

texts.es: Calixta vive en quevedo inicio su tienda de venta de abarrotes hace 12 años. en un principio vendía solo gaseosas, partiendo de ahí tuvo gran acogida. Entre risas nos cuenta que nunca pensé que la gente tomara tanta cola. Con el tiempo su negocio fue ganando acogida con lo cual los clientes empezaron a preguntar por otros productos. Hoy en día tiene una tienda mas surtida con lo cual trabaja de lunes a domingos desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de lo noche. La atención está a su cargo pero recibe ayuda de sus familiares cuando se encuentran de visita, a pesar de tener 61 años se mantiene activa y le gusta. Le preguntamos si tenía algún tipo de inconvenientes en su trabajo y nos informa que no, pero en lo referente a  su salud a estado algo enferma. Calixta es divorciada, tiene 4 hijos todos mayores e independientes. Con el crédito comprara productos para su tienda como gaseosas, confetis, mesa, sillas. Su meta a futuro es remodelar su casa para mejorar su local y aumentarlo.
texts.en:
Calixta lives in Quevedo where she has had a grocery store for 12 years.  At first she only sold soft drinks and it went well.  While smiling, she tells us that she never thought that people could drink so much cola!  In time, her business grew and her customers began asking for other products.  Today she has a well-stocked store and she works from Monday to Sunday, from 6:00 AM to 9:00 PM.

Her focus is to manage her store, but she does get help from her relatives when she needs it.  Although she is 61 years old, she is still active and enjoys working.  We ask her if there are some inconveniences in her work and she tells us that there are not, except that at the moment she is a bit sick.

Calixta is divorced and she has four adult children that are independent.  With this loan she will buy products for her store such as soft drinks, confetti, tables, and chairs.  Her goal is to remodel her home which will help improve her neighborhood and local community.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, party decorations, tables, and chairs.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.
